translation: In the next 80 lifetimes, he'll be a wheel-turning king (from the first volume of the Ten Fascicle Parable Sutra).

source_sentence: 牧牛小兒取華上佛牛觸而死即生天三十六佛泥洹後百年。
translation: A young cowherd boy takes a flower from the top of the Buddha's head, touches it, and dies, and is born in the heavens a hundred years after the thirty-six buddhas go into nirvāṇa.
In the mountains, fields, swamps, and grasses grow abundantly.

source_sentence: 山外不遠有居人村牛馬入池。
translation: Not far beyond the mountain, there was a village of people where cattle and horses entered a pond.
Five-colored lotus flowers were born.
The cowherd's young son enters the pond and takes it.

source_sentence: 滿器蓮華持出山際欲以上佛。
translation: They held the full container of lotus flowers as they left the mountain and wanted to go up to the Buddha.
They hadn't yet reached the temple.
On the way, he met a herd of cattle that had touched and killed the youngster.
The spirit was then born in the Heaven of Thirty-three.
He was naturally born in a palace with five-colored lotus flowers.
When he was first born in that heaven, he thought to himself.
'My palace alone has lotus flowers of different colors.'
"But it's the Dharma of the gods.

source_sentence: 先觀宿命因緣後乃食福。
translation: First, they look at the causes and conditions of their past lives, and then they eat the good fortune.
They then see the previous heaven.

source_sentence: 相謂此天新來共相娛樂云何惶怖不安。
translation: They said, "Why is this god newly arrived and entertained by the company of others?" Why are they so frightened and anxious?
He went to ask him about it.
He replied.
"I was originally a cowherd boy.
I picked lotus flowers and wanted to scatter them at the Buddha's stūpa.
The middle way is impermanent.
It's because of this fortune that I was born here.

source_sentence: 是以今擿華復欲詣先塔散佛禮拜卒我本願。
translation: Now, therefore, I'm going to pick another lotus to go to the previous stūpa to scatter it, venerate the Buddha, and pay homage to him, in keeping with my original vow.
Five hundred celestials then took hold of the lotus flower and scattered it in procession.
They followed them to the stūpa to disperse the Buddha.

source_sentence: 緣是之福彌勒下時當共得道(出譬喻經第五卷)。
translation: Because of this merit, Maitreya will then attain the Way together (from the fifth volume of the Parable Sutra).

source_sentence: 小兒先身以三錢施今解鳥語遂得為王三十七昔有一人。
translation: "A small child who had previously given three coins as alms now understands the words of a bird and becomes king.
With three coins, he gave alms.
He asked for three vows.
One, that he would become king in the future.
Two, he'd understand the words of sentient beings.
Three, he'd have lots of wisdom.
When his life ends, he'll be born in a household of commoners.
His appearance is correct.
The king recruits him to be his right-hand man.
This boy was recruited to serve the king's side.
He saw a swallow in its nest.
He looked up and smiled.
The king asked what he was smiling at.
He replied.
"The swallow said.

source_sentence: 我得龍女髮長十丈喚伴看之。
translation: "I found a dragon lady with hair 10 feet long and asked my companion to look at her.
The king said.
"It's good to judge her.
If you don't have it, you'll be killed.
He sent her away to look at her and she was found.
The king wanted to take the girl and make her his wife.
He said to the boy.
"You understand the birds' words, and you must make many moves.
Give yourself food and provisions.
Find this woman.
If you get one, you'll be rewarded.
If you don't get it, you and your family will be killed.
A young boy went to the edge of the East Sea by forcing himself to die.

source_sentence: 見二人共諍隱形帽履水靴殺活杖。
translation: He saw two people arguing over an invisible hat, shoes, and water boots, and they killed him with a live stick.
The boy said.
"Why is there a need to say that?
'I'll let an arrow fly, and you two will chase it away.'
The one who got it earlier will give you three things.
He replied, "Good!
He draws his bow and releases the arrow.
The two of them fought to get away.
The boy took his hat, put on his boots, and grabbed his staff.
He went straight into the ocean and went to the dragon's quarters.
He took off his invisible hat and showed it to the dragon lady.
The woman had many desires.

source_sentence: 遂與小兒持一䴵金還至外國。
translation: He and the boy then took a piece of gold and returned it to a foreign country.
The king sent them to meet him.
I told him to let the woman enter alone.
The woman then went forward.

source_sentence: 小兒戴隱形帽隨女而入。
translation: The boy put on an invisible hat and followed the woman in.
The woman saw the king's ugliness.
She threw gold at the king's head and broke his arm, killing him.
The boy took off his hat.
He went up to the palace with the woman.
He called out aloud, saying.
"I should be the king's daughter and queen.
I'll rule the world." (From the Zaomiao mieyao jing)

source_sentence: 諸劫分物不識好者三十八
translation: There are 38 people who don't know the finer things in eons.
In the past, there were many merchants.
They went through a dangerous path during an eon.
They greatly lost their clothing.
In the midst of it was a robe.

source_sentence: 是鹿胎毛細軟滑澤織持作衣。
translation: It was made of deer wool that was fine, soft, and smooth, and it was woven and held to make a robe.
It was worth a hundred times as much.
Its color was purple and black, and it didn't please the human eye.
Kapphiṇa didn't reward it by using it separately and holding it as patch.
He used it to carry a debilitating garment that was shared elsewhere.
Each one takes a variety of things and calls them rare and nice.
The rest of the patch was left undistributed.
There's a poor, weak man in Rob's group.
He didn't share it with them alone.
They all begged for the patch with their agonizing arguments.
He then sold it to himself.
A very valuable man then knew it was a good thing.
He hires him according to a limit.
He got an equal share compared to what he got in another eon.

source_sentence: 諸劫聞之大生恥惱(出百句譬喻經第一卷)。
translation: Hearing it, the eons were greatly embarrassed (from the First Fascicle of the Sutra of One Hundred Parables).
